Name: Inner coffin for Ta-baket-en-Khons
Description: This inner coffin belongs to a set consisting of a mummy board, an inner and an outer coffin, found in the Deir el-Bahari cachette (Ã„OS 6264-6266). The wood is covered with linen, the outside smoothed with plaster, and parts of figures and sun discs are modelled in plaster. The paintwork is in the style of the 21st Dynasty and is varnished. The fingers of the lady Tabaket-en-Chons are covered in rings. At the furthest end of the lower part are two beautiful scenes: on the left a tree goddess libating for the kneeling Ta-baket-en-Khons, on the right the tomb in the desert mountains.
